Thanks for your email Michael, I'm sorry you couldn't see the code.  I
just=
 checked and it seems fine; perhaps a temporary glitch at the
wikis host wa=
s the cause?

A direct link to the code download is:
http://javaunittest.pb=
wiki.com/f/TestSpikes.zip

I just checked this link, however, in case there=
 is still some problem
I have also sent you a "yousendit" link to the code =
download.

Many thanks for your time and trouble,
Chris

On 11/15/06, Micha=
el H=FCttermann <michael@...> wrote:

> I would like to have a =
look on your complete code. The page you give
>  the link for has a renderi=
ng error. Could you please fix it and show

>
>  Michae=
l
>
>
>  --- In junit@yahoogroups.com, "Chris Barham" <cbarham@...> wrote:
=
>  >
>  > Hi,
>  > (Also cross-posted to the TestNG list - apologies if you=
 get this twice)
>  >
>  > I am trying to evaluate JUnit 4and TestNG.
>  >
=
>  > I have built classes that use the backwards compatibility of each of
>=
  > the newer test frameworks to enable the reuse of existing JUnit 3.8
>  =
> style test helper classes, (these exercise
>  > equals/hashcode/serializa=
ble/comparable and accessors and come from
>  > the Junit addons project an=
d the TestUtil project).
>  >
>  > Although each testcase works, I'm not en=
tirely happy I am 'doing it
>  right'.
>  >
>  > For example the JUnit 4 co=
de is not working as I expected when I used
>  > the @RunWith(Enclosed.clas=
s)
>  > annotation - it only picks up the enclosed classes, not the public
=
>  > 'outer' class.
>  >
>  > Also, the TestNG code must implement TestCase=
 because the non-public
>  > classes are JUnit 3.8 style, and setting the c=
ompatibility option
>  > seems to preclude using TestNG style tests in the =
public class.
>  >
>  > To illustrate I have a toy class under test, (Perso=
n), and a testcase
>  > for this implemented in each framework. I've posted=
 this code up here:
>  > http://javaunittest.pbwiki.com/
>  > for discussio=
n and correction by anyone and everyone.
>  >
>  > Would members of the lis=
t mind having a look over the code and
>  > suggesting improvements?
>  >
>=
  > Many Thanks!
>  > Chris
>  >
>
>
>
>
